pullRequest.title: Refactoring JarModeProcessor
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes #2934
Modified JarModeProcessor to be an interface which would be implemented by StandardExplodedModeProcessor, StandardPackagedModeProcessor, SpringBootExplodedModeProcessor and SpringBootPackagedModeProcessor.

commit.message: restructure JarModeProcessor to be an interface
add setter for jar path to avoid passing in unused parameter
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:GoogleContainerTools/jib into cli-jar-refactor
fix scope of methods and delete unused jar files

nodes.bodyText: Unfortunately had to modify createLayers() and computeEntrypoint() to no longer accept parameters for the sake of consistency. In the case of createLayers(), while explode mode requires a temporary directory, packaged mode doesn't. On the other hand, computeEntrypoint() for spring-boot exploded doesn't require the jarPath but the same for spring-boot packaged does. The jarPath and temporaryDirectory now need to be set with the help of setters.

I like the direction of this. But instead of JarProcessorHelper returning a type, perhaps it could return a JarProcessor instance?
something where the code might end up looking like:
JarProcessor processor = JarProcessors.for(jarFile, temporaryDirectoryProvider)
containerBuilder = JarFiles.toJibContainerBuilder(processor)
...

Yeah sure.
These are just my ideas, but I think something along these lines could work?
JarProcessors -> has static method for JarProcessor creation from
Remove Mode from most names since we're not exposing that anymore
JarModeProcessor -- rename --> JarProcessor
StandardPackagedModeProcessor -> StandardPackagedJarProcessor... etc?
JarProcessorHelper is kind of a strange name because it doesn't truly say what it is doing (which is the trap that we often fall into when writing helpers), perhaps it could be called JarLayers or something?
could this be called getDirectoryContentsAsLayer or something?

commit.message: add class to create JarProcessor instance and rename classes

nodes.bodyText: Can we only instantiate a new temporary directory when required?

Can these JarProcessor types can just accept the necessary inputs at the constructor level? setJarPath or setTemporaryDirectory seems to be only called during instantiation?
Then the types become more immutable (to some extent).

+import java.nio.file.Path;
+import java.util.jar.JarFile;
+
+/** Class to create a {@link JarProcessor} instance depending on jar type and processsing mode. */
+public class JarProcessors {
+  private static String SPRING_BOOT = "spring-boot";
+  private static String STANDARD = "standard";
+
+  /**
+   * Creates a {@link JarProcessor} instance based on jar type and processing mode.
+   *
+   * @param jarPath path to the jar
+   * @param temporaryDirectory path to temporary directory
+   * @param mode processing mode
+   * @return JarProcessor
+   * @throws IOException if I/O error occurs when opening the jar file
+   */
+  public static JarProcessor from(Path jarPath, Path temporaryDirectory, ProcessingMode mode)
+      throws IOException {
+    String jarType = determineJarType(jarPath);
+    if (jarType.equals(SPRING_BOOT) && mode.equals(ProcessingMode.packaged)) {
+      SpringBootPackagedProcessor processor = new SpringBootPackagedProcessor();

commit.message: introduce constructor parameters and instantiate new temp dir only when needed

nodes.bodyText:
I would check whether this mock is called or not? We only expect it to create a new directory for 2 of the 4 types?
And I would expect no interactions on the other 2?
